intro: Senecio callacallensis, commonly known as the Callacallensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
